Package cern.ais.gridwars.api

Interface UniverseView

  • public interface UniverseView

    Provides an omnipotent view of the two-dimensional game universe during a turn

    Instances of this view will be used by the bot code to inspect the current universe situation during a turn in order to decide on the next movements. The view is omnipotent in the sense that the populations and owners of all cells can be queried.

    IMPORTANT: The UniverseView will be created for each turn, it is therefore important to not store and reuse references to these objects between turns in the bot code.

      • getMyCells

        java.util.List<Coordinates> getMyCells()

        all coordinates of the cells that belong to the current bot

        Returns:
        population at the given position (not necessarily belonging to the current bot)

      • isEmpty

        boolean isEmpty​(Coordinates coordinates)
        Returns:
        true if the cell at the given position has no troops in it, otherwise false

      • isEmpty

        boolean isEmpty​(int x,
                int y)
        Returns:

      • belongsToMe

        boolean belongsToMe​(Coordinates coordinates)
        Returns:
        true if the owner of the cell at the given position belongs to the current bot, otherwise false.

      • belongsToMe

        boolean belongsToMe​(int x,
                    int y)
        Returns:
        true if the owner of the cell at the given position belongs to the current bot, otherwise false.

      • getUniverseSize

        int getUniverseSize()
        Returns:
        width/height of the universe, which is a square (width == height)

      • getGrowthRate

        double getGrowthRate()
        Returns:
        rate at which the population of each cell is increased at the end of a round (every 2 turns)

      • getMaximumPopulation

        int getMaximumPopulation()
        Returns:
        population limit for cells. Cells that grow above this will be "truncated" back down to this value.

      • getTurnTimeOutInMilliseconds

        int getTurnTimeOutInMilliseconds()
        Returns:
        timeout value in milliseconds for each PlayerBot.getNextCommands call. Commands added to the parameter list before the timeout are evaluated, moves added afterwards are ignored.

      • getTurnLimit

        int getTurnLimit()
        Returns:
        maximum number of turns that the game will run. If this value is reached, the player with the highest total population over all cells wins.

      • getCurrentTurn

        int getCurrentTurn()
        Returns:
        current turn number.

      • getCoordinates

        Coordinates getCoordinates​(int x,
                           int y)
        Returns:
        coordinates object at the specified x/y position

      • log

        void log​(java.lang.String message)
        Parameters:
        message - the message that will be logged.
